thread.title: Christion named MVFC Newcomer of the Week
thread.title_full: Christion named MVFC Newcomer of the Week

title: Christion named MVFC Newcomer of the Week
text:
Christion named MVFC Newcomer of the Week 11:17 p.m. CDT October 11, 2015 SDSU's Taryn Christion pushes off the defense of Indiana State's Kendall Walker from Indiana State en route to a touchdown in the first half of their game Saturday night at Coughlin Alumni Stadium. (Photo: Dave Eggen / Inertia) 7 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ST. LOUIS -- South Dakota State University freshman quarterback Taryn Christion has been named the Missouri Valley Football Conference Newcomer of the Week for his efforts in helping lead the Jackrabbits to victory over Indiana State on Oct. 10. Taryn Christion sparks SDSU to victory 
A Sioux Falls native, Christion accounted for 320 yards of total offense in the Jackrabbits' 24-7 home victory. Starting in place of an injured Zach Lujan, Christion opened the scoring with a 10-yard touchdown run early in the second quarter, then threw his first career touchdown pass – a 34-yarder to Jake Wieneke – later in the quarter. For the game, Christion completed 15-of-24 passes for 221 yards and carried the ball 16 times for 99 yards. 
The Jackrabbits, 4-1 overall and 1-1 in league play, will face their third nationally ranked opponent in a row, traveling Saturday to Youngstown State. Kickoff is set for 3 p.m. Read or Share this story: http://argusne.ws/1Lqd0aT TOP VIDEOS
